_comment: Deep link configuration for TV Alarm Clock. Edit this file to fix broken deep links without changing code. Version number should be bumped whenever you change anything.

NETFLIX._comment: Netflix Android TV. MUST use com.netflix.ninja (not .mediaclient). MUST include source=30 extra or deep links land on home screen instead of content.
NETFLIX.contentIdHint: Use the number from the Netflix URL (e.g., 80057281 for Stranger Things)

YOUTUBE._comment: YouTube on Android TV. TESTED: https:// format auto-plays, vnd.youtube: may NOT auto-play. Use https first.
YOUTUBE.contentIdHint: The letters after watch?v= in a YouTube link (e.g., dQw4w9WgXcQ)

HULU._comment: Hulu on Android TV. TESTED Feb 2026: Completely opaque to uiautomator. Deep link lands on show page, NOT player. Needs force-stop before launch, then 3x DPAD_CENTER (profile bypass + start playback). ContentLaunchService handles this.
HULU.contentIdHint: The UUID from a Hulu episode URL

DISNEY_PLUS._comment: Disney+ on Android TV. Web-style deep links are the known working format.
DISNEY_PLUS.contentIdHint: The content ID from a Disney+ URL

PRIME_VIDEO._comment: Prime Video on Android TV. TESTED Feb 2026: Intent filter accepts watch.amazon.com authority. Use ASIN-based URL. The .livingroom package is for TV.
PRIME_VIDEO.contentIdHint: The ASIN code from an Amazon Prime Video URL (e.g., B078GY1HJV)

HBO_MAX._comment: Max (formerly HBO Max). TESTED Feb 2026: /video/watch/{uuid} goes straight to playback after profile bypass. Verified with Friends S1E1 (UUID 0e33e070-5a45-425a-b655-9d7a7a6658ba). Completely opaque WebView. Needs 2x DPAD_CENTER for profile bypass.
HBO_MAX.contentIdHint: The UUID from a Max URL (e.g., 0e33e070-5a45-425a-b655-9d7a7a6658ba for Friends S1E1)

SLING_TV._comment: Sling TV for live TV channels. TESTED Feb 2026: Deep link BROKEN on cold start (player stuck). App must be launched normally first (auto-plays last channel), then deep link sent to switch channels. ContentLaunchService handles this two-phase approach.
SLING_TV.contentIdHint: Channel name like 'Fox News', 'CNN', 'ESPN' (use the display name)

PEACOCK._comment: Peacock (NBCUniversal). Asset IDs are from Peacock URLs.
PEACOCK.contentIdHint: The asset ID from a Peacock URL

PARAMOUNT_PLUS._comment: Paramount+ (formerly CBS All Access). TESTED: /watch/ path works. Also supports /live-tv/ for live channels. pplus:// scheme also registered. Needs profile bypass CENTER press.
PARAMOUNT_PLUS.contentIdHint: The video ID from a Paramount+ URL

APPLE_TV._comment: Apple TV+ on Android TV. Package name is long but correct.
APPLE_TV.contentIdHint: The show path from an Apple TV+ URL

TUBI._comment: Tubi (free streaming). TESTED Feb 2026: Supports tubitv:// scheme with media-playback (auto-play), media-details (show page), and live-news authorities.
TUBI.contentIdHint: The number from a Tubi URL (free streaming!)

PLUTO_TV._comment: Pluto TV (free live TV). Channel IDs are slug strings like 'cbs-news'.
PLUTO_TV.contentIdHint: The channel slug from a Pluto TV URL (free live TV!)

CRUNCHYROLL._comment: Crunchyroll (anime). Episode IDs are alphanumeric strings.
CRUNCHYROLL.contentIdHint: The episode path from a Crunchyroll URL (anime streaming)

YOUTUBE_TV._comment: YouTube TV (live TV service, separate from regular YouTube). Package is tvunplugged.
YOUTUBE_TV.contentIdHint: Live TV channel or recording ID

FUBO_TV._comment: fuboTV. Package com.fubo.firetv works on Fire TV, com.fubo.tv is generic Android TV. Both are checked.
FUBO_TV.contentIdHint: Channel or content ID for live sports and TV

DISCOVERY_PLUS._comment: Discovery+ (now merging with Max in some regions). Android TV specific package.
DISCOVERY_PLUS.contentIdHint: The video ID from a Discovery+ URL

PLEX._comment: Plex media server client. Uses plex:// custom URI scheme. Metadata keys look like /library/metadata/12345.
PLEX.contentIdHint: The metadata key for your Plex media (e.g., /library/metadata/12345)

STARZ.contentIdHint: The content ID from a Starz URL
